page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY/OVERTON
page.content: The parish villages were named in the last Domesday survey:-they are Overton, Middleton and Heysham.Only Sunderland Point was not named.The settlement there only developed at the time of LancasterÂ£s trade with the West Indies. It is safe to assume that the Vikings sailed longships up the river Lune.Many local places bear Viking names still:- Trumacar,Trailholme,and Trumley to name a few.Overton church dates from Anglo- Saxon times,rebuilt @1152 and extended in 1733.In Anglo-Saxon times,grazing land was held in common,the village had a Â£poundÂ£ in front of the present Â£Globe InnÂ£,and there was a village Â£mootÂ£.Until 1947 there was a smithy, next to Glebe Farm,one of the oldest houses in the village.Building still goes on at the foot of Hall Greaves.
